alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 2:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST/645 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona near Havasupai Reservation and Supai, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST /645 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM MST /338 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Heather Wash, Black Tank Wash, Coconino Wash, Pasture Wash, Havasu Creek, Royal Arch Creek, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Little Coyote Canyon and Colorado River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Havasupai Reservation and Supai. - This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
